paper_title: Time to Get Conversational: Assessment of the Potential of Conversational User Interfaces for Mobile Banking
dependent_variable_main_theme: Theme 6: Technology Acceptance and Adoption Intentions
independent_variable: Conversational User Interface Type (CUIbaseline, CUIspeech, CUIhybrid)
effect_direction_full_context: NO EFFECT: No significant relationship was found between the independent variable (Conversational User Interface Type) and the dependent variables (acceptance, trust, user experience, and perceived security).
independent_variable_measurement_others:
The independent variable in this study is the type of conversational user interface (CUIbaseline, CUIspeech, and CUIhybrid). The measurement technique used to assess the impact of these variables involved standardized questionnaires, including:
  
  Technology Acceptance Model (TAM): Used to measure acceptance with subscales such as perceived usefulness (PU), perceived ease of use (PEOU), attractiveness (ATT), trust (TRU), and intention (INT). 
  Trust Scale: From Jian, Bisantz, and Drury, used to measure trust (TS-TRU) and mistrust (MTRU). 
  User Experience Questionnaire - Short Version (UEQ-S): Used to assess user experience with subscales for hedonic quality (HQ) and pragmatic quality (PQ). 
  Perceived Security: Measured using three adapted items from Cheng, Lam, and Yeung, with an 11-point Likert scale. 
  
  These questionnaires were administered to participants after each task during the study.

effect_direction_full_context: POSITIVE: As the independent variable (use of Chatbot for assistance regarding customer service) increases, the dependent variable (use of Chatbot for recommendation regarding offers and discounts) also increases.

paper_title: Participatory Design with Domain Experts: A Delphi Study for a Career Support Chatbot
effect_direction_full_context: POSITIVE: As the independent variable (expert consensus and input) increases, the dependent variable (quality and alignment of chatbot design and evaluation criteria) improves.
independent_variable_measurement_others:
The independent variable measurement technique used in the study includes questionnaires with Likert scale responses and qualitative free-text responses. The study employed a Delphi method, which involved three rounds of structured questionnaires to gather expert opinions, refine consensus, and validate requirement statements. 
  Other techniques used include:
  
  Design fictions: Presented in the first round to elicit qualitative insights and familiarize participants with the possibilities of conversational agents. 
  Pseudo-dialogue: Used in the second round, where participants responded to direct quotes from their peers to refine their opinions. 
  Requirement statements: Synthesized from previous rounds and validated in the final round using binary agree/disagree responses. 
  
  Qualitative data was analyzed using thematic coding (deductive and inductive) with the assistance of NVIVO software.
sample_size_full _context: Sample Size: The study had 23 participants who completed the first questionnaire, with 20 participants completing the third and final round.
